reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the hotel was obviously recently remodeled, our room lacked adequate storage space and was very cramped.
reviews.title: Wouldn't ever stay at the Amfora again!

reviews.text: The bathroom contained a very modern commode with a wooden seat similar to an outhouse with a wooden cover. Quite bluntly, it reminded me of sitting in an outhouse!
reviews.title: Almost 5*

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every time the glass door to the outside was opened, the air conditioning would shut off and a repairman had to be summoned to realign the sensor on the door. Consequently we discontinued even touching the door and even advised the maid not to do so again.
reviews.title: A great island resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel staff at the front desk was always very helpful and courteous but the repairman who had to be repeatedly summoned concerning the air conditioning sensor was not and was indeed outright rude.
reviews.title: The hotel that ate an island.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is not handicap friendly and leaving the hotel to visit Hvar town required traveling walking down a minimum of forty-five steps and walking up forty-five steps upon your return.
reviews.title: Very modern, clean hotel, but service is cold, so is pool
A bit large and impersonal but right for us
reviews.text: Yes it is large and not intimate, but I loved the facilities, especially the pool and access to the beach. While I loved the harbor area of Hvar, it was a nice break to take the ten minute stroll back to the hotel, away from all the hussle and bussle of the marina area. Rooms are spotless and modern, however the architectural beauty of the bathrooms is off-set by the silly toilet and sinks which have to be experienced to know what I am talking about. LOVED Hvar and this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here at the start of June at the time of the worst thunderstorms and rain to hit the coastline for 10 years. Rain, rain, rain.
reviews.title: Conference hotel on a lovely island

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were met on arrival by the hotel minibus which was a nice touch. Check-in was quick and easy. We got the room we paid for, but as the hotel was less than 20% I think an upgrade would have been nice.
reviews.title: Croatia and this hotel are in deed spectacular.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was nicely decorated, very clean and did have a sea view.
reviews.title: Great place to relax and enjoy the beautiful city of Hvar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The weather was terrible, so bad that we struggled to leave the hotel. We went there for sun!! The remaining guests all ate bar meals and the staff struggled to cope.
reviews.title: OK it looks like an airport,but we loved it!

reviews.text: The Amfora tries to sell you on it's great 4 star rating, however, it's more like a 2-3 Star Property.
reviews.title: NOT a Luxury Hotel - A Disappointment

reviews.text: Pool - Full of moss. The swim up bar is disgusting. Moss growing literally on the seats. NO ONE sat there. No music at the pool with the exception of a soft radio from time to time. Very limited menu for drinks and food. Kid and adult pool, however, the children overtook all of the pools. Moss growing in the bottom of the pool. Light chlorine. Not enough pool loungers. You had to be up at 7AM to get a chair every day.
reviews.title: Love/hate relationship with Amfora - mostly hate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach - No beach access via hotel. They gated their previous access. Must leave property and go to paid private beach club for $100 USD per day for 2 chairs OR go to public beach which was overcrowded and you must pay for chair.
reviews.title: Large and impersonal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spa - They say their is a spa onsite. You have to leave and go to the private beach club for outdoor massages or go to the full service spa in the city at the sister hotel the Adriana.
reviews.title: Great Hotel - recommended, watch out for some quirks !

reviews.text: Food - SUCKED!! Free breakfast, but sick most days. VEry limited, orange eggs, sausages, juice, some fruit cocktail (canned), tomatoes, breads.
reviews.title: Had to call few times the reception

reviews.text: Great location and great stay!!! Hula Hula bar is a hoot...go for happy hour to see the sun set.
reviews.title: Excellent stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was our first time in Hvar so we didn't know what to expect. On the boat on the way over to the Island we happened to sit next to one of the hotel managers (Goran) where we were staying. Not only was he a nice person, he arranged for our rooms to be ready, walked us to the hotel and was just overall very helpful. The Amfora is a short walk from Hvar port and even though it's a big hotel, you don't feel like you are on top of everyone.
reviews.title: Beautiful relaxing holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would also recommend treating yourself to the Bonj Les Bains, just ask the helpful concierge staff.
reviews.title: Amfora - Sunsational Week Package

reviews.text: My partner and I stayed at the Amfora Hotel in Hvar in June 2009.
reviews.title: Very Good-once you relax and just accept some of the flaws...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first impression, after a 5 hour long trip from Zadar (bus and boat), and the overall lasting impression, was very good.
reviews.title: awesome place, great pool, great room, loved it
